title: Drain life (monster attack)
data:
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| [ ]## Contents* [1 Description](#Description)

  - [1.1 Versus characters](#Versus_characters)
  - [1.2 Versus monsters](#Versus_monsters)

* [2 Monsters with the attack](#Monsters_with_the_attack)

* [3 Internals](#Internals)

* [4 Strategy](#Strategy)

* [5 Messages](#Messages)

* [6 References](#References) |

**Drain life** is a monster attack [damage type](/wiki/Damage_type "Damage type") that may reduce the [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level") of the defender.

## Description

If a drain life attack hits and passes through [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), then it has a 1⁄3 chance of taking effect.

It may be prevented by [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance"), [magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation"), or if the attacker is a [cancelled](/wiki/Cancelled "Cancelled") monster.

### Versus characters

- *Main article: [Experience level#Losing levels](/wiki/Experience_level#Losing_levels "Experience level")*

The character's experience level is reduced by 1, killing them if their level reaches 0; their [experience points](/wiki/Experience_points "Experience points") are reduced to the maximum for their new level. Maximum and current [hit points](/wiki/Hit_points "Hit points") and [energy](/wiki/Energy "Energy") are reduced by the same amount as they would have been increased had the player gained a level. They cannot be reduced below one hit point and zero energy points.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

### Versus monsters

The monster's level is reduced by 1, killing them if their level reaches 0; their maximum and current hit points are reduced by [2d6](/wiki/D_notation "D notation"). If their hit points are reduced below 1, they die.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Monsters with the attack

The following monsters have this attack:

- V [all vampires](/wiki/Vampire_\(monster_class\) "Vampire (monster class)")
- W [all wraith class monsters](/wiki/Wraith_\(monster_class\) "Wraith (monster class)")
- & [Demogorgon](/wiki/Demogorgon "Demogorgon")

Additionally, if the [system configuration option](/wiki/Sysconf#SEDUCE "Sysconf") SEDUCE is not set, then [foocubi](/wiki/Foocubi "Foocubi") have a drain life attack rather than a seduction attack.

## Internals

Drain life is represented by the macro **AD\_DRLI**.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Strategy

[Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") and an extremely good [armor class](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class") reduce the chances of an attack hitting and getting through. If you expect to get hit many times, you can equip MC3 items or wield one of the [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") artifacts.

Most of the time, the hero immediately regains the first lost level from the experience gained by killing the attacker. If you do lose two or more levels at once, you can regain all the levels by quaffing a blessed [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability"), or regain one level by quaffing an uncursed [potion of restore ability](/wiki/Potion_of_restore_ability "Potion of restore ability") or a blessed [potion of full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing").

## Messages

- - Goodbye level \<number>
  - Fare thee well level \<number>
  - Sayonara level \<number>
  - Aloha level \<number>
  - Farvel level \<number>

  You have been drained one level.

- \<monster> suddenly seems weaker!

  A monster has been drained one level.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/mhitu.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1195](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitu.c#L1195)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/exper.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 200](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/exper.c#L200)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1301](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mhitm.c#L1301)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [include/monattk.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 52](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/include/monattk.h#L52)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Drain life (monster attack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Contents

Drain life is a monster attack damage type that may reduce the experience level of the defender.

Description

If a drain life attack hits and passes through magic cancellation, then it has a 1⁄3 chance of taking effect.

It may be prevented by drain resistance, magic cancellation, or if the attacker is a cancelled monster.

Versus characters

Main article: Experience level#Losing levels

The character's experience level is reduced by 1, killing them if their level reaches 0; their experience points are reduced to the maximum for their new level. Maximum and current hit points and energy are reduced by the same amount as they would have been increased had the player gained a level. They cannot be reduced below one hit point and zero energy points.[1][2]

Versus monsters

The monster's level is reduced by 1, killing them if their level reaches 0; their maximum and current hit points are reduced by 2d6. If their hit points are reduced below 1, they die.[3]

Monsters with the attack

The following monsters have this attack:

  • V all vampires
  • W all wraith class monsters
  • & Demogorgon

Additionally, if the system configuration option SEDUCE is not set, then foocubi have a drain life attack rather than a seduction attack.

Internals

Drain life is represented by the macro AD_DRLI.[4]

Strategy

Magic cancellation and an extremely good armor class reduce the chances of an attack hitting and getting through. If you expect to get hit many times, you can equip MC3 items or wield one of the drain resistance artifacts.

Most of the time, the hero immediately regains the first lost level from the experience gained by killing the attacker. If you do lose two or more levels at once, you can regain all the levels by quaffing a blessed potion of restore ability, or regain one level by quaffing an uncursed potion of restore ability or a blessed potion of full healing.

Messages

Goodbye level <number>
Fare thee well level <number>
Sayonara level <number>
Aloha level <number>
Farvel level <number>
You have been drained one level.
<monster> suddenly seems weaker!
A monster has been drained one level.

References

  2. ↑ src/exper.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 200
  3. ↑ src/mhitm.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 1301
  4. ↑ include/monattk.h in NetHack 3.6.7, line 52
